project_overview.summary: With its origin as the CLP headquarters in 1940, the Grade 1 historic building, known as the CLP clock tower, sits beneath Kadoorie Hill and has played witness to the transformation of Hong Kong's energy landscape. Standing as a testament to the past, the building has been converted into a museum with distinct themes: Electricity and Local Heritage, which offer invaluable insights into the city's electrification journey and its rich cultural heritage.

featured_image_with_text.content: The exhibition is divided into six distinct zones - “Social Historical”, “Energy Planning”, “Sustainability”, “Power Generator” and “Immersive Area”, each offering a unique experience and insights.

featured_text_1.content: The exhibition highlights the essence of electricity and the overarching theme of "making the invisible visible" with diverse multimedia exhibits engage and educate visitors.

subtitle_and_body_1.subtitle: Energy Trilemma
subtitle_and_body_1.body: The interactive multimedia experience provides visitors with a comprehensive understanding of the framework encompassing three key objectives that energy policymakers must navigate when designing energy policies. The programme would transform the considerations made by the visitors on “Environmental Sustainability”, ”Energy Equity” and ”Energy Security ” into an trilemma chart. Visitors can also compare energy trilemma charts from various countries, allowing them to envision this framework on a global scale.

highlighted_content_with_gallery_1.title: Immersive Room
highlighted_content_with_gallery_1.content:
As visitors step into the immersive room, they experience firsthand the far-reaching impact of fossil fuel consumption on our global ecosystem. Through motion tracking-projections, this interactive experience serves as a compelling call to action. 

The enveloping visuals allow visitors to gain a deeper understanding of the consequences of their decisions, inspiring them to wholeheartedly embrace positive change for a sustainable future.

highlighted_content_with_gallery_2.title: Other Exhibits
highlighted_content_with_gallery_2.content: We have curated a collection of digital exhibits to enhance the visitor experience, which includes a series of supplementary e-books, transparent-screen database ,decarbonisation game and more. These digital offerings provide further insights and interactive opportunities, ensuring a comprehensive and immersive exploration of the subject matter.
